Mirrors can be used as portable makeup stations or dressing rooms, allowing individuals to check their appearance or apply makeup easily, especially when traveling or on-the-go.
A broken mirror can be used to create a DIY decorative project where the shattered pieces of glass are arranged to create a unique mosaic or wall art.
Reflective mirrors can be used to help gardeners and farmers monitor livestock or crops by using the reflections to observe the animals or plants from a distance.
A mirror can be used as an affordable and temporary substitute for a flat screen TV, using it to reflect the light from a computer screen or to display photographs and drawings.
A mirror can be used as a support for other items, such as potted plants, lamps, or decorative pieces, by propping up their base against the mirror's surface.
